lines: Greetings! Klaus here. Pleasure to make your acquaintance.
Valentin and I go way back - we studied together at university.
He's been perfecting that erdbeerstrudel recipe for years!
introduction.notebookNote: Klaus is an old friend of Valentin's from university. Knows about the strudel recipe history.

lines: I can't believe this happened! Poor Valentin...
I was admiring his book collection when the strudel went missing.
This is absolutely outrageous. We need to find the culprit!
followUpLines: As Valentin's friend, I want justice!
Someone here is lying, I'm sure of it.

lines: I must confess, Valentin's recipes haven't always been... perfect.
We used to critique each other's cooking back in university. Sometimes quite harshly.
followUpLines: But that was years ago! I'd never sabotage his work now.
We've moved past those petty competitions.
postIncident.notebookNote: Klaus and Valentin used to critique each other's cooking harshly. Old rivalry?

lines: You're proving quite thorough in your investigation.
I respect that. Truth should always come to light.
Between you and me, I think Sebastian was acting strangely earlier. Very nervous.
followUpLines: I'm not one to spread rumors without evidence.
But you might want to press him a bit harder.
postIncident.notebookNote: Klaus thinks Sebastian was acting nervous. Genuine observation or misdirection?

lines: I suppose I should be honest now.
I did taste a small piece when Valentin wasn't looking. But I didn't eat the whole thing! Someone else must have finished it.
followUpLines: It was just a tiny sample! For old time's sake.
I know how it looks, but I'm not the main culprit here.
postIncident.notebookNote: Klaus admits to tasting the strudel but denies eating all of it. Partial truth?
